name: Ritchie Tiongson
text: A double-click problem typically means that the retension spring mechanism has been pushed/worn down to the point where the computer is interpreting the resulting slower springback as a second click. Only solution without having to open the mouse and retension the spring is to buy a new one.

Only solution without having to open the mouse and retension the spring is to buy a new one.

replies.text: If it's a higher end mouse (worth thousands), and double clicking is the only problem then retensioning the spring (it's not really a corscrew type spring) might be worth it. I only ever did that with one mouse in the last 20 years (a Razr). Each time the repair lasted about 4-6 months. I only changed the mouse when it started double clicking again just 1 month after the last repair.
